lead_paragraph: Autopsy results show a University of Central Florida football player who died after spring drills had a pre-existing medical condition worsened by physical stress. The Orange County Medical Examiner’s Office said Thursday that the player, Ereck Plancher had a sickle cell trait that caused problems with his red blood cells during physical exertion. Plancher, 19, collapsed in March, the day before spring practice was to begin.
